name: IBM
desc: I currently work at IBM as a full stack DevOps software engineer.

name: UNC-Chapel Hill
desc: While working on my MSIS at UNC-Chapel Hill, I worked as a Research Assistant. Below are two of the projects I worked on during my time at UNC.

projects.name: AnnotatorOne Prototypes
projects.desc: The AnnotatorOne project was a research project to explore different user interfaces for large scale web annotations. Several iterations were created, one of which is viewable on Heroku. With thousands of annotations on a web page, I worked on several JavaScript/DOM performance improvements. On the design side of things, I created icons and worked on several interaction design challenges.

images.alt: Screenshot of the AnnotatorOne Prototype (1 of 2)
Screenshot of the AnnotatorOne Prototype (2 of 2)

projects.name: MyBCRisk.org Responsive Website
projects.desc: The website mybcrisk.org contains a questionnaire for users to assess their breast cancer risk. As a responsive website, it works on desktop, tablet, and mobile.

images.alt: Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org desktop home page
Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org mobile home page
Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org desktop question page
Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org mobile question page

projects.name: NC Hospital Charges Visualization
projects.desc: As part of a graduate course in Visual Analytics, I worked with 2 classmates on a D3 visualization of hospital charge data in NC. The visualization shows a map of NC, plotting averages for hospital charges by Diagnosis Related Group (DRG), on each hospital. A color scale is used to designate the range of low to high averages. Clicking a hospital brings up its details and shows how it compares to others for the same DRG. The site and source is hosted on a classmate's GitHub account.

images.alt: Screenshot of NC Hospital Charges visualization (1 of 2)
Screenshot of NC Hospital Charges visualization (2 of 2)

name: Etix
desc: I worked at Etix as the sole front-end engineer from mid-2012 to mid-2013. I did some designing, some usability testing, a whole lot of refactoring of user interface code, and worked a little bit on some Java code in a J2EE web app that ran on Tomcat.

projects.name: Style Guide
projects.desc: As my first order of business at Etix, I created a styleguide to give myself and the other developers some standards for developing user interface components. Since my departure, it's been heavily revised, so the current site most likely does not reflect what I created.

projects.name: Checkout Process Redesign
projects.desc: I redesigned and developed a responsive template for the checkout process that led to a 2% increase in mobile revenue in its first month.

images.alt: Screenshot of Etix.com checkout process (1 of 2)
Screenshot of Etix.com checkout process (2 of 2)

projects.name: Wireframes
projects.desc: I created conceptual wireframes for a dashboard and for the Etix print-at-home ticket. I worked with several stakeholders across the organization to gather requirements for the concepts.

images.alt: Screenshot of Balsamiq wireframe for a dashboard
Screenshot of Balsamiq wireframe for a print-at-home ticket

projects.name: Schema.org Metadata Implementation
projects.desc: I implemented Schema.org metadata recommendations on the Etix site in order to provide structured data in search results in supported search engines. The accompanying screenshot shows an example of this structured data being used by Google to improve the search results interface.

images.alt: Example of Google search results showing Etix metadata

name: Lowe's Home Improvement
desc: I worked at Lowe's Home Improvement as a front-end developer from 2010 to 2012. I created new landing pages for the site, worked on the home page ocassionally, created bookmarklets for internal use by coworkers, worked on a proof of concept for integrating Flickr photos and Google maps, and mentored other developers. I was part of two different Agile teams at different times while I was there: first, as part of the Cart/Checkout team, and later as part of the Folders & Lists MyLowes team.

projects.name: RESTful Web Service Integration
projects.desc: I was involved in several projects that integrated complex, AJAX-heavy user interfaces with RESTful back-end services.
